intro: Malanea verticillata, commonly known as the clustered malanea, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its whorled arrangement of leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. The fruit is a capsule that releases small, wind-dispersed seeds.
